questions.question: State whether the sentence is in 'active' or 'passive' voice: 'A mistake was made by me.'
questions.explanation: The sentence is in passive voice because the subject 'mistake' receives the action. The structure 'was made' (was + V3) and the agent 'by me' are indicators of passive voice.

questions.question: State whether the sentence is in 'active' or 'passive' voice: 'Lata sang a song in English.'
questions.explanation: The sentence is in active voice because the subject 'Lata' performs the action of singing. The verb 'sang' is in simple past active form.

questions.question: State whether the sentence is in 'active' or 'passive' voice: 'She was brought up by her aunt.'
questions.explanation: The sentence is in passive voice. The subject 'She' receives the action of being brought up. The structure 'was brought up' (was + V3) and 'by her aunt' indicate passive voice.

questions.question: State whether the sentence is in 'active' or 'passive' voice: 'I opened the door for the guests.'
questions.explanation: The sentence is in active voice because the subject 'I' performs the action of opening. The verb 'opened' is simple past active.

questions.question: Change from active voice to passive voice: 'I am bending the branch.'
questions.answer: The branch is being bent by me.
key_points: Present continuous: am bending → is being bent

questions.question: Change from passive voice to active voice: 'He was given a reward.'
questions.answer: Someone gave him a reward. / They gave him a reward.
key_points: Simple past passive → simple past active

questions.question: Change from active voice to passive voice: 'Is she boiling potatoes?'
questions.answer: Are potatoes being boiled by her?

questions.question: Change from active voice to passive voice: 'She sent invitation cards to her friends.'
questions.answer: Invitation cards were sent to her friends by her.

questions.question: Choose the correct passive form of: 'The teacher is explaining the lesson.'
options: The lesson is explained by the teacher.
The lesson is being explained by the teacher.
The lesson was being explained by the teacher.
The lesson has been explained by the teacher.
questions.correct_answer: The lesson is being explained by the teacher.
questions.explanation: Present continuous active (is explaining) becomes present continuous passive (is being explained). The structure is: is/am/are + being + V3.

questions.question: Choose the correct passive form of: 'They have completed the project.'
options: The project was completed by them.
The project is completed by them.
The project has been completed by them.
The project had been completed by them.
questions.correct_answer: The project has been completed by them.
questions.explanation: Present perfect active (have completed) becomes present perfect passive (has been completed). The structure is: has/have + been + V3.

questions.question: Choose the correct passive form of: 'Someone stole my bicycle yesterday.'
options: My bicycle has been stolen yesterday.
My bicycle was being stolen yesterday.
questions.explanation: Simple past active (stole) becomes simple past passive (was stolen). 'By someone' is omitted as the agent is unknown.

questions.question: Choose the correct passive form of: 'The children will sing the national anthem.'
options: The national anthem will be sung by the children.
The national anthem is sung by the children.
The national anthem was sung by the children.
The national anthem will be singing by the children.
questions.correct_answer: The national anthem will be sung by the children.
questions.explanation: Simple future active (will sing) becomes simple future passive (will be sung). The structure is: will + be + V3.

questions.question: Change to passive voice: 'The gardener is watering the plants.'
questions.answer: The plants are being watered by the gardener.
key_points: Present continuous: is watering → are being watered

questions.question: Change to passive voice: 'My mother had prepared dinner before we arrived.'
questions.answer: Dinner had been prepared by my mother before we arrived.
key_points: Past perfect: had prepared → had been prepared

questions.question: Change to active voice: 'The window was broken by the naughty boys.'
questions.answer: The naughty boys broke the window.
key_points: Simple past passive → simple past active

questions.question: Change to passive voice: 'The doctor can cure this disease.'
questions.answer: This disease can be cured by the doctor.
key_points: Modal verb passive: can cure → can be cured

questions.question: Which sentence is in passive voice?
options: The letter was posted by her.
questions.correct_answer: The letter was posted by her.
questions.explanation: Only 'The letter was posted by her' is passive. The subject 'letter' receives the action, and 'was posted' (was + V3) is the passive verb form.

questions.question: Which sentence CANNOT be changed to passive voice?
questions.explanation: 'Sleep' is an intransitive verb (no object), so it cannot be changed to passive voice. Only transitive verbs (with objects) can be made passive.
